description: After the Halden-Index AI's self-suspension, Rada Miskovic agonizes over her next move, weighing the destabilized city and Council paralysis. She decides to broadcast Halden's uncensored archives, believing citizens deserve the truth to shape Stenograd's future.

Rada releases Halden’s full, unedited journals and BCI safety protocols on CityNet, urging citizens to read, debate, and organize public forums. Stenograd is electrified by revelations of Halden’s warnings and intentions.

Grassroots discussion groups spring up across districts, with Oksana Lintz facilitating open forums to interpret Halden's guidance. Citizens demand Council accountability and debate the future of BCI governance.

Council infighting erupts over how to respond to Halden’s archives. Public confidence plummets further as citizen coalitions propose dismantling the current Council and forming a transparent, directly elected assembly.

Amid mass demonstrations, Council loses authority. A new citizen assembly is established, committed to transparency, local participation, and voluntary cooperation, marking the end of algorithmic rule in Stenograd.
